name: biomni-perform-mwas-cyp2c19-metabolizer-status
title: Biomni: Perform Mwas Cyp2C19 Metabolizer Status
description: Performs methylation-wide association study (MWAS) for CYP2C19 metabolizer status
content:
Overview

Performs methylation-wide association study (MWAS) for CYP2C19 metabolizer status. Identifies DNA methylation patterns associated with poor, intermediate, extensive, or ultra-rapid metabolizer phenotypes for pharmacogenomic applications.

Input Parameters

  • methylation_data_path (required): Path to methylation array data (beta values)
  • metabolizer_status_path (required): Path to CYP2C19 phenotype data (PM/IM/EM/UM classifications)
  • covariates_path (optional): Path to covariate data (age, sex, batch effects)
  • pvalue_threshold (optional): Significance threshold for CpG sites (default: 0.05)
  • output_file (optional): Output filename for significant CpG sites (default: 'significant_cpg_sites.csv')

Input Format

{
  "methylation_data_path": "/path/to/methylation_data.csv",
  "metabolizer_status_path": "/path/to/phenotypes.csv",
  "covariates_path": "/path/to/covariates.csv",
  "pvalue_threshold": 0.05,
  "output_file": "significant_cpg_sites.csv"
}

Biological Use Case

Critical for understanding epigenetic regulation of drug metabolism. CYP2C19 metabolizes clopidogrel, proton pump inhibitors, and many antidepressants. Identifying methylation biomarkers enables improved prediction of drug response beyond genetic polymorphisms, supporting personalized medicine and precision dosing strategies.

Output

MWAS results with significant CpG sites, effect sizes, p-values, and metabolizer status associations saved to mwas_results.txt

Category

pharmacology
